it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.provider

Class CoapProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.mjcoap.coap.provider.CoapProvider

  • public class CoapProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    CoAP message communication service (i.e. the CoAP messaging layer) for sending and receiving CoAP messages.

    For sending a CoAP message you have just to pass the given message and the target socket address to the method send(CoapMessage, InetSocketAddress).

    For receiving CoAP messages you have to create a CoapProviderListener (implementing the CoapProviderListener.onReceivedMessage(CoapProvider, CoapMessage) method) and call the method addListener(CoapId, CoapProviderListener) specifying also the kind of messages you are interested to receive. This is achieved by passing a CoapId that identifies the message context for which you want to receive messages. The message context should be one of the following:

    1. reliable transmission
    2. transaction (i.e. request/response exchange)
    3. blockwise transfer
    4. message method (GET, PUT, POST, DELETE)
    5. message type (request or response)
    6. any
    Class CoapId provides methods for creating identifiers of any of the above types. When the CoAP layer receives a message, it passes the message to the listener of the first message context according to the order of above list. That is, if a listener for a reliable transmission that matches the message is found, that listener is called, otherwise a listener for the request/response transaction, a blockwise transfer, message method, or message type is searched. If no listener for any previous context is found, the listener for all message (if present) is used.

    • Method Detail

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets CoAP port.
        Returns:
        the local UDP port used by CoAP

      • addListener

        public void addListener(CoapId id,
                        CoapProviderListener listener)
        Adds a new CoapProvider listener.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of a CoAP method, of a reliable transmission, or of a transaction; it specifies the kind of messages that the listener is interested to receive.
        Use the proper get method of class CoapId (e.g. CoapId.getMethodId(CoapRequestMethod.GET), or CoapId.getTransactionId(msg.getRemoteSocketAddress(),msg.getToken()), or CoapId.getReliableTransmissionId(msg.getRemoteSocketAddress(),msg.getMessageId())), for capturing only the messages you are interested in.
        Otherwise, you can use CoapId.REQUEST for capturing all request messages, or CoapId.ANY for capturing all messages (both requests and responses)
        listener - the CoapProvider listener

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(CoapId id)
        Removes a CoapProvider listener.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of a CoAP method, a reliable transmission, or a transaction, associated to the listener that has to be removed

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(CoapProviderListener listener)
        Removes a CoapProvider listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that has to be removed
